alert.note: Alert for Central Chelan County; Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 4:21PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Chelan County through 445 PM PDT... At 421 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northwest of Merrit, or 14 miles northeast of Stevens Pass, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Merrit, Telma, Riverside Campground, Lake Creek Campground, Lake Wenatchee Campground, White Pine Campground, and Grouse Creek Campground. This includes U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 68 and 69, and between mile markers 74 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Western Chelan County
